title: Bellingham PD: 1987 Bellingham Steam Plant John Doe

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Bellingham PD: 1987 Bellingham Steam Plant John Doe
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents, dispatch logs, incident reports, follow-up reports, copies of medical examiner's reports or photographs, or anything that could be construed as a "case file" or "case documents" or "relevant documents" related to the discovery of the skeletal remains of an unidentified decedent (likely) male discovered in a steam plant in Bellingham on September 20th of 1987. Please include a search for any electronic communication (to or from) either NCIC or WACIC related to these unidentified remains.

The Bellingham PD agency case number is: 87B-24528

Thank you for taking the time to review this request for relevant documents, and thank you to the Bellingham Police Department for the department's commitment to transparency. I am involved in open-source investigations into unidentified decedent cases and this request is being filed in the public interest.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: AI fake nude photos - school year prep (Issaquah School District)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: AI fake nude photos - school year prep (Issaquah School District)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Last school year, your school district had an incident of AI generated fake nude images (sometimes called “deepfakes”) being made of students. I’m reaching out to ask about and obtain any materials the school is making or preparing in order to educate students about these images or the consequences o making them.

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:
1) Any lesson plans, curriculum plans, assembly plans, or presentation plans held by this school district that discuss AI generated fake nude images/deepfakes, or the apps that create these images. If you need a query search, you can search for materials that mention “AI” OR “a.i.” OR “artificial intelligence” OR “deep fake” OR “deepfake”. Please include any slide presentations, memoranda, or notes associated with any of these lesson plans or presentations. Please limit the time frame of this request from July 1, 2023 to the time that this request is processed.

This FOI request is being filed in pursuit of a time-sensitive news story. Therefore, I ask that my request is expedited. I'll note that these records may contain personally identifiable information, and I ask that this information is redacted where it appears, as opposed to not including the entire record.

If there are any questions about my request, or I can provide any clarification that will help expedite the processing of my request, please contact me at emailcarolinehaskins@gmail.com. I am also happy to hop on the phone.

If you determine that any of the information qualifies for an exemption from disclosure, I ask you to note whether the exemption is discretionary, and if so whether it is necessary in this case to exercise your discretion to withhold the information. In any event, please provide a signed notification citing the legal authorities on which you rely if you determine that any of the information is exempt and will not be disclosed.

Also, I am a member of the news media as a reporter, and the requested documents are in the public interest and not being made for commercial purposes. Therefore, I ask that all fees are waived in the processing of my request.

Thanks again, and I look forward to your response within 5 business days, as the statute requires, and hopefully even sooner, if my request is expedited.

Best,
Caroline Haskins

communications.subject: Public Records Request

The attached letter conveys the District's response to your recent public records request. Please let me know if you have any questions.

Best Regards,

Kristen Maginnis

Issaquah School District

files.title: 8.30.2024 Haskins response
files.source: Issaquah School District, Issaquah, WA

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #172583-72506828
communications.communication:
Hi, thanks for your quick response. However, If I may speak honestly, a 2025 response date is completely unreasonable under the circumstances. 

1) This district released 1000+ pages of responsive documents to me and to 404 Media mere weeks after them initial deepfake incident in your district. So, there is a precedent for a reasonable response time to requests that are much wider in scope.

2) It’s clear from those very documents that the school district did not have any materials planned to educate students about deepfakes through the entirety of the time period pertaining to the request. This limits the period of my request in which there will actually be responsive documents substantially. But I don’t know when, or if, responsive documents may begin to appear in my case.

I don’t want to believe that this is a case of intentional obfuscation — perhaps this was a standardized response of sorts. However, I have pro bono legal representation who represents me in FOI disputes, including cases where the response time is unreasonable under the circumstances. I’d prefer to not escalate this to the level of legal proceedings. So, I kindly ask for your district to reassess the time estimate for completing my FOI request, and to provide a breakdown detailing why the request will take that amount of time to complete.

Thank you,
Caroline

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #172583-72506828
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Haskins,

Thank you for your email. Please note the District intends to process your request in conjunction with the numerous other public records requests it is currently processing. Your request as written is seeking “any lesson plans, curriculum plans, assembly plans, or presentation plans held by the school district that discuss AI generated fake nude images/deepfakes, or the apps that create these images” as well as “any slide presentations, memoranda, or notes associated with any of these lesson plans or presentations.” Given the broad nature of your request, our search for records will require us to reach out to every teacher and administrator in the District, notify third parties affected by the request, and conduct a comprehensive review for any information that may be exempt from disclosure in accordance with the Washington State Public Records Act (RCW 42.56, et seq.). To allow sufficient time for the District to locate and review potentially responsive records, as well as provide third party notice in instances where the District is contractually required to do so, the District continues to estimate that it will need sixty (60) days, or until October 28, 2024, to prepare an initial production of responsive records. Following the initial production, the District will continue to produce responsive records on an installment basis and at intervals sufficient to allow for the review and third party notification process to occur. If the records are available sooner, we will notify you and if the District needs to update an estimated production date, we will notify you as permitted by RCW 42.56.520.

If you wish to narrow or otherwise clarify your request, please feel free to contact me.

Best Regards,

Kristen Maginnis
Public Records Specialist
Issaquah School District
(425) 837-7259
maginnisk@issaquah.wednet.edu<mailto:maginnisk@issaquah.wednet.edu>
[cid:image001.png@01DAFECC.971DD870]<http://www.issaquah.wednet.edu/>
This e-mail contains confidential information intended only for the use of the addressee(s) named above. If you are not the intended recipient of this e-mail, or the employee or agent responsible for delivering it to the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any dissemination, distribution or copying of this e-mail is strictly prohibited. If you have received this e-mail in error, please notify sender and delete. Thank You.

title: Maryland Parole Commission Members' Names, Terms, Salaries

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Maryland Parole Commission Members' Names, Terms, Salaries
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The following information for each of the ten current Maryland Parole Commissioners (Md. Code, Corr. Servs. § 7-202) and each current hearing examiner (Md. Code, Corr. Servs. § 7-204): 
-Full Name (First and Last)
-2024 Annual Salary (for each individual person, not the total budget line item)
-Term Expiration Date (month, day, year)

Note: If the hearing examiners do not have official terms, that item can be left blank.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jacob Wourms

title: Expense Reports for 2019 to 2021 submitted by BOE trustees

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Expense Reports for 2019 to 2021 submitted by BOE trustees
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all expense reports and/or receipts submitted from July 1, 2019 to June 30, 2021 by Mark Kamberg, Robert V. Fallarino, Leonard Hirsch, and David Keefe, Trustees of the board of education.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mary Lee

This letter is an acknowledgment of your request for records pursuant to the Freedom of Information Law (“FOIL”) received by the District on August 13, 2024.  Please be advised, the District is currently investigating whether the requested records exist and/or are accessible under FOIL.  We anticipate providing you with a response on or before September 17, 2024. If such records exist and/or are accessible under FOIL, you will be advised as to the payment of fees, if applicable.

MuckRock News
DEPT MR 171826
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115
Attn: Mary Lee
	RE: 	FOIL Request dated August 13, 2024
Dear Ms. Lee:
	As you are aware, the East Williston Union Free School District (“District”) received your Freedom of Information Law (“FOIL”) request dated August 13, 2024.  Specifically, you requested the following: “Any and all expense reports and/or receipts submitted from July 1, 2019 to June 30, 2021 by Mark Kamberg, Robert V. Fallarino, Leonard Hirsch, and David Keefe, Trustees of the board of education.”
	Please be advised the District requires additional time to respond to and process your request.
	In determining a reasonable time for granting or denying a request, agencies, such as the District, shall “[1] consider the volume of a request, [2] the ease or difficulty in locating, retrieving or generating records, [3] the complexity of the request, [4] the need to review records to determine the extent to which they must be disclosed, [5] the number of requests received by the agency, [6] and similar factors that bear on an agency’s ability to grant access to records promptly and within a reasonable time.”  The following factors are applicable here: one, four, five, and six.  Specifically, your request seeks records that must be reviewed to determine whether an exception to FOIL exists and requires substantial effort to prepare (i.e., copy, scan and redact).  This is in addition to the other tasks the District must undertake. 
As such, it is anticipated that the District will either grant or deny your request on or before October 15, 2024. 
Pursuant to FOIL, if it is determined that your request is denied in-whole or in-part, you have the right to appeal a denial of any portion of your request within thirty (30) days to the Superintendent of Schools, Dr. Danielle Gately, East Williston Union Free School District, 11 Bacon Road, Old Westbury, New York 11568. You will be advised in writing of the Superintendent’s decision of your appeal within ten (10) business days following receipt of any written appeal. Pub. Off. Law § 89(4)(a).
									Sincerely, 
								
									DIANE CASTONGUAY
									Records Access Officer

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Expense Reports for 2019 to 2021 submitted by BOE trustees
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I'm following up on the following New York Freedom of Information Law request, copied below, and originally submitted on Aug. 13, 2024. You had previously indicated that it would be completed on Dec. 12, 2024. I wanted to check on the status of my request, and to see if there was a new estimated completion date.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

MuckRock News
DEPT MR 171826
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

Attn: Mary Lee

	RE: 	Response to FOIL Request dated August 13, 2024

Dear Ms. Lee:

This letter serves as a determination concerning your email request dated August 13, 2024 for records pursuant to the Freedom of Information Law (“FOIL”).  Specifically, you requested the following: “Any and all expense reports and/or receipts submitted from July 1, 2019 to June 30, 2021 by Mark Kamberg, Robert V. Fallarino, Leonard Hirsch, and David Keefe, Trustees of the board of education.”
Please be advised, your request is granted in part and denied in part, insofar as the requested records are being provided to you with redactions, as explained below:
•	Portions of the requested records which, if disclosed, would constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy have been withheld and/or identifying details redacted pursuant to Public Officers Law §§ 87(2)(b), 89(2).  For example, home address, personal email address, and credit card number have been redacted, as the release of such information would constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy.  See Pub. Off. Law § 87(2)(b).  
•	Public Officers Law §87(2)(i) permits an agency to deny access to records or portions thereof that, “if disclosed, would jeopardize the capacity of an agency or an entity that has shared information with an agency to guarantee the security of its information technology assets, such assets encompassing both electronic information systems and infrastructures.” Disclosure of information such as bank account numbers and check numbers could enable a person to gain access to or alter or adversely affect electronic information or electronic information systems, as such, they may justifiably be withheld.  § 87(2)(i). See FOIL-AO-14921 (2004); FOIL-AO-13948 (2003); FOIL-AO-13143 (2002); FOIL-AO-F9325 (1996).
•	Also, information that is non-responsive to your request has been redacted.

Enclosed please find records redacted in accordance with the above.  Further, the District has determined there are no records relating to Robert V. Fallarino and Leonard Hirsch. 
Pursuant to FOIL, if it is determined that your request is denied in whole or in part, you have the right to appeal a denial of any portion of your request within thirty (30) days to the Superintendent of Schools, Dr. Danielle Gately, East Williston Union Free School District, 11 Bacon Road, Old Westbury, New York 11568. You will be advised in writing of the Superintendent’s decision of your appeal within ten (10) business days following receipt of any written appeal. Pub. Off. Law § 89(4)(a).
									
Sincerely, 

									DIANE CASTONGUAY
Records Access Officer

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Video Request/22-MM-000150-A-K/Kenneth Norman Campbell 3
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { law name }, I hereby request the following records:
This is a request for DASHCAM and BWC video for the first two squads on scene and any subsequent BWC video related to the arrest of the primary suspect in this matter. (As a formality, this request is being made under open records statutes governing this data.)

Please also include the police report from the primary officer or the probable cause statement. You can exclude any PII. The narrative is the most important part. 

If the individual was NOT arrested on camera, please let us know as we will likely cancel the request. 

Name: Kenneth Norman Campbell 3
Monroe County Court Case Number:22-MM-000150-A-K
Description: HIT AND RUN - LEAVE SCENE OF CRASH INVOLVE DAMAGE TO PROP (more than $50 damage) Statute: 316.061(1) Misdemeanor Second Degree
Date of Birth: 04/09/1994
Offense Date: 01/13/2022
Filing Date: 01/18/2022

IF YOUR AGENCY DOES NOT USE BODY CAMERAS:
If you do not have a body camera video related to this incident, please let us know. We will likely cancel the request if your agency was not using BWC at the time of the incident. (Exception: State Troopers - we will still want state trooper dash cams.)

EXCLUDED FROM THIS REQUEST:
Exclude any portion of footage involving personally identifiable information (PII)
Exclude portions of the video in which minors are visible
Exclude portions involving nudity, explicit or graphic content (blur, redact, or cut)
Exclude any other portion of the video at your discretion. 

DOWNLOAD FORMAT:
No paper cuts, please! :) Digital download is preferred whenever possible (Evidence.com, iCrimeFighter, Box.com, etc.) 

Thank you in advance for any consideration,
Kristina Hicks | Volunteer

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Kristina Hicks

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Agency Roster
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to all sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.subject: 24-FTS-7124 Thompson - Response
communications.communication:
Dear Toni Thompson:

This correspondence is in response to your request for public records pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), which the Illinois Department of Human Services (IDHS) received on December 5, 2024.  Your request seeks the following:

Find the request for proposal, statement of work, contract award notifications, all related documents and the contract awarded for the Child Care Management System Replacement RFP 19-444DHS-MIS44-B-7213 issued in June 2019 by the Illinois Department of Early Childhood.

Attached you will find records responsive to your request.  Th Department redacted signatures pursuant to Section 7(1)(b) of FOIA, which applies to private information. 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(b); 5 ILCS 140/2(c-5).  To the extent you consider any portion of this response to be an improper denial of your FOIA request, you have a right to seek review by writing to the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the following address:

Public Access Counselor
Office of the Attorney General
500 South 2nd Street
Springfield, Illinois 62706
Fax: 217-782-1396
E-Mail: Public.Access@ilag.gov<mailto:Public.Access@ilag.gov>

If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this response when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. You also have the right to seek judicial review of this response. 5 ILCS 140/11.

Thank you for your interest in the Illinois Department of Human Services.

Sincerely,


Thomas Mulcrone (he/him/his)
Assistant General Counsel | Office of the General Counsel
Illinois Department of Human Services
Email: DHS.FOIAOfficer@illinois.gov<mailto:DHS.FOIAOfficer@illinois.gov>

[IDHS Illinois Department of Human Services]





State of Illinois - CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE: The information contained in this communication is confidential, may be attorney-client privileged or attorney work product, may constitute inside information or internal deliberative staff communication, and is intended only for the use of the addressee. Unauthorized use, disclosure or copying of this communication or any part thereof is strictly prohibited and may be unlawful. If you have received this communication in error, please notify the sender immediately by return e-mail and destroy this communication and all copies thereof, including all attachments. Receipt by an unintended recipient does not waive attorney-client privilege, attorney work product privilege, or any other exemption from disclosure.

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Montgomery County Weekend Incarceration Fees
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Related to Maryland Code §11-801, which permits counties to impose fees on "weekend incarcerated individuals"; specifically 

1. The per diem rate, or daily charge, of the weekend incarceration fee imposed in the county detention/correctional facility both currently and in FY23.
2. The daily “average cost of providing food, lodging, and clothing for an incarcerated individual” in the county detention/correctional facility used to calculate the weekend incarceration fee in FY23.
3. The total number of individuals charged the weekend incarceration fee in the county detention/correctional facility in FY23. 
4. The total amount of fees collected from weekend incarcerated individuals in the county detention/correctional facility in FY23.
5. All policies and procedures regarding the imposition and collection of the weekend incarceration fee, including but not limited to guidelines on how these fees are determined and collected in the county detention/correctional facility.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wayne Byun

communications.subject: FW: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Montgomery County Weekend Incarceration Fees
communications.communication:
Below is the response to your inquiry, refer to blue font.

Related to Maryland Code §11-801, which permits counties to impose fees on "weekend incarcerated individuals"; specifically

1. The per diem rate, or daily charge, of the weekend incarceration fee imposed in the county detention/correctional facility both currently and in FY23.  This was discontinued during FY 2012.
2. The daily "average cost of providing food, lodging, and clothing for an incarcerated individual" in the county detention/correctional facility used to calculate the weekend incarceration fee in FY23. Refer to the attachment for food cost and the per diem can be found by clicking the following link:  FY23-Per Diem.xlsx<https://www.montgomerycountymd.gov/COR/Resources/Files/DataDashboard/FY23-Per%20Diem.pdf>
3. The total number of individuals charged the weekend incarceration fee in the county detention/correctional facility in FY23. none
4. The total amount of fees collected from weekend incarcerated individuals in the county detention/correctional facility in FY23. none
5. All policies and procedures regarding the imposition and collection of the weekend incarceration fee, including but not limited to guidelines on how these fees are determined and collected in the county detention/correctional facility.N/A

Kaye Beckley, MBA, CCP, CPM, SPHR, SHRM-CSP

communications.subject: Iowa Open Records Law Request: Body camera video
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Iowa Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all body camera video regarding the incident/citation INC #2024009180. Citation #224551 on 11/01/2024 for violation Public Urination.

The citation was paid and this matter should be considered closed. The records should no longer be considered confidential under Iowa Code 22.7(5), as it is no longer an ongoing investigation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Edmund Burke

communications.subject: RE: Iowa Open Records Law Request: Body camera video
communications.communication:
Requestor,

Please find attached the complaint and call for service regarding this incident. As previously stated, body cam footage is considered to be confidential under Iowa Code 22.7(5) which is also attached. The Iowa City Police Department Records division considers your request closed. Have a good day!

Lauryn Rich

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Facility vacancy rates, 2013-2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Security, non-security, COI & corporal, and total vacancy rates for each facility from July 2013 to July 2024. If possible, please provide the vacancy rates for each month during this period. 

If any of these data are not available, please provide what is available (for instance, total vacancy rates or annual rates by facility). 

Thank you for your assistance with this request. Please do not hesitate to contact for questions or clarifications.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Ben Goehring.

title: Phi Theta Kappa records (Maricopa County Community College District)

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Phi Theta Kappa records (Maricopa County Community College District)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Copies of all records provided by your college to Phi Theta Kappa from Jan. 1, 2024 to Sept 20, 2024.
2. Copies of all records provided to your college from Phi Theta Kappa from Jan. 1, 2024 to Sept 20, 2024.
3. Copies of correspondence sent from Phi Theta Kappa to your college president, CEO and/or chancellor from Jan. 1, 2024 to Sept 20, 2024.
4. Copies of all records showing the number of students in the top 10% of their class as of May 1, 2024. If the community college does not collect data about class rank, please state so.
5. Records showing the number of students who are members of Phi Theta Kappa on your campus, and the number of students invited to Phi Theta Kappa over the past year.
6. Copies of all records showing the amount of money your college paid to Phi Theta Kappa from Jan. 1, 2023 to Sept 20, 2024 and for what purposes.  
7. Copies of all records showing the amount of money your college received from Phi Theta Kappa from Jan. 1, 2023 to Sept 20, 2024, and for what purposes.  
8. Your college's policy for the handling of student data provided to and provided by Phi Theta Kappa.

Context: Phi Theta Kappa in their invitations tells students that they are in the "top 10% of students on your campus." I am trying to ascertain whether that is accurate, whether Phi Theta Kappa receives follow-up information from colleges on student GPA, and how Phi Theta Kappa obtains student personal data, and what kind of data, in the first place.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Marina Villeneuve

Thank you.
[image: Maricopa Community College District Office logo]

MARICOPA COMMUNITY COLLEGES
Office of General Counsel - Public Stewardship Services
2411 West 14th Street, Tempe, AZ 85281
public.records@info.maricopa.edu
https://www.maricopa.edu/

communications.subject: RE: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Phi Theta Kappa records (Maricopa County Community College District)
communications.communication:
Hello,

1. Copies of all records (including records concerning student information, such as lists of students, their contact information, GPA) provided by your college to Phi Theta Kappa from Jan. 1, 2024 to Sept 20, 2024.
2. Copies of all records  (including records concerning student information, such as lists of students, their contact information, GPA) provided to your college from Phi Theta Kappa from Jan. 1, 2024 to Sept 20, 2024.

Phi Theta Kappa through its PTK Connect program (https://recruitptk.org/) provides data on students to universities.

Phi Theta Kappa also receives data about students from community colleges. Phi Theta Kappa then uses that data to send invitations to students. 

I am looking to see what sort of records that colleges and universities are providing to Phi Theta Kappa, and what records colleges and universities are receiving. I am looking to see, for example, whether Phi Theta Kappa is receiving information about student GPA from colleges. 

I can be reached at 617-528-8101 if you'd like to discuss and narrow further.

Sincerely,
Marina Villeneuve

communications.subject: Re: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Phi Theta Kappa records (Maricopa County Community College District)
communications.communication:
Hello,

Thank you for your inquiry.  The search for records in response to your
request is still ongoing.



Given the volume and breadth of your request, it involves searching an
email archive system as well as gathering records from ten independently
accredited colleges within the Maricopa Community College District.  You
have requested records in 8 broad categories, is there one of the
categories that you would like to prioritize?



We often release records that are voluminous on a roll out basis - for
example releasing them in batches (versus waiting until all documents are
processed).   As soon as there are records available for release, we will
let you know.



Kind regards.
[image: Maricopa Community College District Office logo]

MARICOPA COMMUNITY COLLEGES
Office of General Counsel - Public Stewardship Services
2411 West 14th Street, Tempe, AZ 85281
public.records@info.maricopa.edu
https://www.maricopa.edu/

communications.subject: RE: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Phi Theta Kappa records (Maricopa County Community College District)
communications.communication:
Thank you!

If possible, I would like to prioritize #8: Your college's policy for the handling of student data provided to and provided by Phi Theta Kappa.



Sincerely,
Marina Villeneuve

communications.subject: RE: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Phi Theta Kappa records (Maricopa County Community College District)
communications.communication: Also, I would like to narrow the email request to emails from domain @ptk.org to your college president/chancellor.

handling of student data, please see the web links below that are readily

<https://district.maricopa.edu/governing-board-operations/board-policies> and
the Administrative Regulations
<https://district.maricopa.edu/administrative-regulations>.


A friendly reminder that records requests are processed in the order
received and
we will follow up with you directly upon completion of the search and
review of documents.


Thank you.

MARICOPA COMMUNITY COLLEGES

2411 West 14th Street, Tempe, AZ 85281
public.records@info.maricopa.edu
https://www.maricopa.edu/

Bradshaw, 106 Nev. 630, 798 P.2d 144 (1990) ), information about victims of crimes (Nevada Constitution, Article 1, Section 23; NRS 178.5691); and information relating to individuals’ private interests such that disclosure to the public would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of privacy (Clark Cnty. title: Comprehensive Request for Records on USS Liberty Incident

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Comprehensive Request for Records on USS Liberty Incident
communications.communication:
January 19, 2024

National Security Agency
ATTN: FOIA Office
9800 Savage Rd., Suite 6932
Fort George G. Meade, MD 20755-6932
Email: foia@nsa.gov

Re: Freedom of Information Act Request

Dear FOIA Office,

Subject: Comprehensive Request for Records on USS Liberty Incident

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I am seeking access to specific records pertaining to the USS Liberty incident that occurred on June 8, 1967.

Request for Records:

Unreleased Signal Communications: All signal communications, including those on VHF/UHF and high-frequency bands, intercepted or recorded by the NSA on June 8, 1967, related to the USS Liberty incident that were not included in the previous release.
Withheld Information Details: Detailed specifics regarding communications or data that remain classified, including reasons for continued classification and any internal NSA discussions on the potential for declassification.
Comprehensive Incident Analyses: Any complete reports or analyses conducted by the NSA regarding the USS Liberty incident, especially those focusing on signal intelligence (SIGINT), that have not been previously released.
Legal Basis and Precedents:

Reference to Wilkinson v. FBI, 633 F. Supp. 336 (C.D. Cal. 1986), regarding the limits of Glomar responses.
Citing Department of Justice v. Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press, 489 U.S. 749 (1989), and Department of Defense v. FLRA, 510 U.S. 487 (1994) for the necessity of detailed processing of FOIA requests.
Referencing EPA v. Mink, 410 U.S. 73 (1973), for the importance of substantive review of classified materials.
ACLU v. CIA, 710 F.3d 422 (D.C. Cir. 2013), which clarifies the limits of Glomar responses following public acknowledgment.
Fee Waiver Request:
Enclosed is a Fee Waiver Request [attach Fee_Waiver_Letter.pdf], as the information sought is for public knowledge and understanding, and not for commercial use.

Response Expectations:
A timely response within the 20-working-day statutory period as outlined in FOIA is expected. In the event of any denial or partial fulfillment, a detailed justification referencing specific FOIA exemptions is required.

Legal Preparedness:
This request is structured for use in potential legal proceedings to enforce compliance with the FOIA. Inadequate response or non-compliance may result in legal action.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter

Enclosures:

Fee_Waiver_Letter.pdf

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Mel King School - School-Based Arrests
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This letter constitutes a request pursuant to the Public Records Act, M.G.L. c.66, §10, for public records in the custody of your police department. Under the Criminal Justice Reform Act, school districts and law enforcement agencies must “specify the manner and division of responsibility for collecting and reporting the school-based arrests, citations and court referrals of students to the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education” (DESE). DESE began collecting data on school-related arrests in the 2018-19 school year. In the 2019-20 school year, DESE expanded that collection to include data on all referrals to law enforcement. DESE has defined these terms as follows, borrowing the same definitions used by the U.S. Department of Education since its 2009 Civil Rights Data Collection. 
•	A school-related arrest “[r]efers to an arrest of a student for any activity conducted on school grounds, during off campus school activities (including while taking school transportation), or due to a referral by any school official. All school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.” 
•	A referral to law enforcement “[i]s an action by which a student is reported to any law enforcement agency or official, including a school police unit, for an incident that occurs on school grounds, during school-related events, or while taking school transportation, regardless of whether official action is taken. Citations, tickets, court referrals, and school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.” 

This request is for the calendar years 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, and 2024, up to and including the day the records are produced. The scope of the request is the Mel H. King Academy South End Academy, formerly known as the McKinley schools, including all records for the following schools:
•	Elementary: 90 Warren Avenue, Boston, MA 02116.
•	K-12 Academy: 90 Warren Avenue, Boston, MA 02116.
•	Middle: 50 St. Mary’s Street, Boston, MA 02215.
•	Prep: 97 Peterborough Street, Boston, MA 02115.
Throughout this request, “School” refers to all of the schools described above. “School-related arrest” refers to “an arrest of a student for any activity conducted on school grounds, during off campus school activities (including while taking school transportation), or due to a referral by any school official. All school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”

For the School and time period described above, I request the following public records, as defined in G. L. c. 4, § 7 (twenty-sixth):
1.	An extract of your records management system or database that includes each school-related arrest and each referral to law enforcement. 
2.	Specifically, I request a database extract including the following variables:
a.	Date of arrest or referral to law enforcement
b.	Time of arrest or referral to law enforcement
c.	Charge (or charges) including the statute governing the alleged offense 
d.	Whether the individual(s) was arrested or referred to law enforcement
e.	Sex of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
f.	Age of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
g.	Race of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
h.	Ethnicity of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
i.	Disability status of the individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
j.	Whether the individual arrested or referred to law enforcement is a student at the school.
k.	Name of arresting officer, if applicable, and 
l.	Badge number of the arresting officer or the officer that referred the youth to law enforcement, as applicable.
3.	If a database extract as described in bullets 1–2 is not possible, please provide any existing police reports on each school-related arrest and referral to law enforcement. 
4.	The total number and a brief description of 911 calls from the School that were received by your department.

As this request involves a matter of public interest and will not be used for any commercial purpose, we ask that all fees associated with this request be waived pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(k). Moreover, for municipalities with a population of over 20,000, the first two hours of time spent searching for, compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record may not be charged a fee. Finally, pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(i), a records access officer shall assess no fee greater than the lowest hourly rate of a person capable of compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. In the event that a charge is incurred for this request which you will not waive, please so indicate and include an itemization of estimated good faith costs.

Please provide public records to a requestor in an electronic format unless the record is not available in an electronic format. M.G.L. c. 66, § 6A(d). 

The Public Records Act requires that you comply with this request within ten (10) business days following receipt. If you believe that documents or data responsive to any request herein is not public record and thus not subject to disclosure, please set forth in writing the specific reasons for such assertion, including the specific exemption or exemptions that you believe apply. To the extent that you determine that records need to be redacted in order to be produced under any law protecting the privacy of named individuals, please do so rather than withholding them in their entirety.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days. If you have any questions about this request, or need additional time to respond, please contact me by phone at (617)-338-1050 or by email at averyfarmer@cfjj.org. Thank you in advance for your prompt response to this request.

Sincerely,
Avery Farmer
Citizens for Juvenile Justice

All school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”
• A referral to law enforcement “[i]s an action by which a student is reported to any law enforcement agency or official, including a school police unit, for an incident that occurs on school grounds, during school-related events, or while taking school transportation, regardless of whether official action is taken. Citations, tickets, court referrals, and school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”

All school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”

For the School and time period described above, I request the following public records, as defined in G. L. c. 4, § 7 (twenty-sixth):

communications.subject: Police Records Request :: B003226-110724
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
Reference No: B003226-110724 Dear Avery Farmer: The Boston Police Department (BPD) has received your request for public records.  This response applies only to records that exist and are in the custody of the BPD. See A Guide to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, p. 32, n.115.  It is expected that a custodian of records must use her superior knowledge of her records with respect to responses to public records requests.  950 CMR 32.04(5).  Specifically, you stated: To Whom It May Concern: 

This letter constitutes a request pursuant to the Public Records Act, M.G.L. c.66, §10, for public records in the custody of your police department. Under the Criminal Justice Reform Act, school districts and law enforcement agencies must “specify the manner and division of responsibility for collecting and reporting the school-based arrests, citations and court referrals of students to the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education” (DESE). DESE began collecting data on school-related arrests in the 2018-19 school year. In the 2019-20 school year, DESE expanded that collection to include data on all referrals to law enforcement. DESE has defined these terms as follows, borrowing the same definitions used by the U.S. Department of Education since its 2009 Civil Rights Data Collection. 
• A school-related arrest “[r]efers to an arrest of a student for any activity conducted on school grounds, during off campus school activities (including while taking school transportation), or due to a referral by any school official. All school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.” 
• A referral to law enforcement “[i]s an action by which a student is reported to any law enforcement agency or official, including a school police unit, for an incident that occurs on school grounds, during school-related events, or while taking school transportation, regardless of whether official action is taken. Citations, tickets, court referrals, and school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.” 

This request is for the calendar years 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, and 2024, up to and including the day the records are produced. The scope of the request is the Mel H. King Academy South End Academy, formerly known as the McKinley schools, including all records for the following schools: 
• Elementary: 90 Warren Avenue, Boston, MA 02116. 
• K-12 Academy: 90 Warren Avenue, Boston, MA 02116. 
• Middle: 50 St. Mary’s Street, Boston, MA 02215. 
• Prep: 97 Peterborough Street, Boston, MA 02115. 
Throughout this request, “School” refers to all of the schools described above. “School-related arrest” refers to “an arrest of a student for any activity conducted on school grounds, during off campus school activities (including while taking school transportation), or due to a referral by any school official. All school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.” 

For the School and time period described above, I request the following public records, as defined in G. L. c. 4, § 7 (twenty-sixth): 
1. An extract of your records management system or database that includes each school-related arrest and each referral to law enforcement. 
2. Specifically, I request a database extract including the following variables: 
a. Date of arrest or referral to law enforcement 
b. Time of arrest or referral to law enforcement 
c. Charge (or charges) including the statute governing the alleged offense 
d. Whether the individual(s) was arrested or referred to law enforcement 
e. Sex of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement 
f. Age of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement 
g. Race of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement 
h. Ethnicity of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement 
i. Disability status of the individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement 
j. Whether the individual arrested or referred to law enforcement is a student at the school. 
k. Name of arresting officer, if applicable, and 
l. Badge number of the arresting officer or the officer that referred the youth to law enforcement, as applicable. 
3. If a database extract as described in bullets 1–2 is not possible, please provide any existing police reports on each school-related arrest and referral to law enforcement. 
4. The total number and a brief description of 911 calls from the School that were received by your department. 

As this request involves a matter of public interest and will not be used for any commercial purpose, we ask that all fees associated with this request be waived pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(k). Moreover, for municipalities with a population of over 20,000, the first two hours of time spent searching for, compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record may not be charged a fee. Finally, pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(i), a records access officer shall assess no fee greater than the lowest hourly rate of a person capable of compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. In the event that a charge is incurred for this request which you will not waive, please so indicate and include an itemization of estimated good faith costs. 

Please provide public records to a requestor in an electronic format unless the record is not available in an electronic format. M.G.L. c. 66, § 6A(d). 

The Public Records Act requires that you comply with this request within ten (10) business days following receipt. If you believe that documents or data responsive to any request herein is not public record and thus not subject to disclosure, please set forth in writing the specific reasons for such assertion, including the specific exemption or exemptions that you believe apply. To the extent that you determine that records need to be redacted in order to be produced under any law protecting the privacy of named individuals, please do so rather than withholding them in their entirety. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days. If you have any questions about this request, or need additional time to respond, please contact me by phone at (617)-338-1050 or by email at averyfarmer@cfjj.org. Thank you in advance for your prompt response to this request. 

Sincerely, 
Avery Farmer 
Citizens for Juvenile Justice

L. c. 66, § 10 (a); 950 CMR 32.06(2)(b).  The public records law permits a response time of up to twenty-five (25) business days from the business day a written request is received, so long as a detailed explanation is provided.  G. L. c. 66, § 10(b)(vi); 950 CMR 32.06(2)(i). Due to the nature of your request additional time is needed.  As such, BPD will need up to, but no more than, fifteen (15) additional business days to review and process your request.

communications.subject: Police Records Request :: B003226-110724
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Avery 
Could you please elaborate on what you mean by "referrals"?

communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request #B003226-110724
communications.communication:
Good morning,

Of course! By referrals, we mean: any time that a student is "reported to BPD for an incident that occurs on school grounds, during school-related events, or while taking school transportation, regardless of whether official action is taken." This also includes incidents that result in citations, tickets, court referrals, and school-related arrests.

Does that help?

Sincerely,
Avery

title: Information/files concerning Guerini crime family (Central Intelligence Agency)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled (Central Intelligence Agency)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All files suitable for release pertaining to the Guerini brothers (alternatively, the  Guérini brothers or Antoine and Barthélémy Guerini , nicknamed "Mémé"), known for their involvement in organized crime in France.  
Specifically of interest are files relating to their involvement in docks/shipyards and communist political violence between 1946-1952.  This should not be taken to exclude documents published after this time period that describe their activities during that time.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Edward Nestor

title: FOIA Request: COVID-19 Relief Programs’ Economic Impact Data

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Request: COVID-19 Relief Programs’ Economic Impact Data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting copies of documents containing information on the economic impact and outcomes of COVID-19 relief programs administered by the Department of the Treasury, specifically data and reports from the period of January 2020 through December 2022.

This request seeks to understand the implementation and effects of relief efforts, such as the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) and the Coronavirus Relief Fund (CRF), on small businesses and local economies across the United States. I am requesting data and reports generated, reviewed, or utilized by Treasury officials during the specified period to evaluate these programs' effectiveness.

As a journalism student at Northwestern University’s Medill School of Journalism, I am requesting this information for non-commercial, educational purposes. Disclosure of this information is in the public interest, as it will contribute significantly to understanding the federal government's response to economic challenges caused by the COVID-19 pandemic. The requested records will support a broader analysis for public dissemination in news and academic channels, ensuring a clear understanding of government operations and fiscal responses during a critical time. Therefore, I respectfully request a waiver of all fees associated with this request under 5 U.S.C. Section 552(a)(4)(A)(iii).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Cathy Sun

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Request: COVID-19 Relief Programs’ Economic Impact Data
communications.communication:
Dear FOIA Officer,

I am writing to follow up on my FOIA request submitted on November 1st, 2024 regarding the economic impact and outcomes of COVID-19 relief programs administered by the Department of the Treasury, specifically data and reports from January 2020 through December 2022.

As a reminder, I requested documents related to the implementation and effects of relief efforts such as the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) and the Coronavirus Relief Fund (CRF). This request is for non-commercial, educational purposes as part of my journalism studies at Northwestern University’s Medill School of Journalism.

Please let me know if additional information or clarification is required to process my request. I can be reached via:

Email: lixuansun2026@u.northwestern.edu
Phone: 2063875571
I would greatly appreciate any updates regarding the status of my request. If you anticipate any delays or require further details, please let me know so that I can assist in expediting the process.

Thank you for your attention to this matter, and I look forward to your response.

Best regards,
Cathy Sun

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Patron Incident Reports - November 2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

All Patron Incident Reports submitted for the Area Manager 5 North Region from November 15 through November 30 in 2024.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit Lucy Parsons Labs for the purpose of public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexandra Gelzin

communications.communication:
Dear Requestor,

We appreciate your patience as we are still working on this request.  Per section 140/3(e), the Park District is extending the time to respond to your request by five business days and I will get it to you sooner if it is possible.  The reasons:

(x ) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records;

(x) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under  Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: NYRA audit records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All records provided to the State Comptroller's offfice by the New York Racing Association in connection with the audit published January 18, 2024, entitled "Purchasing and Procurement Practices (Follow-Up), " including but not limited to: Bid Exclusion Memos, spreadsheets, purchasing data templates,

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sam Mellins

title: Mount Wachusett CC Vendor Expenses, FY15-FY24

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Mount Wachusett CC Vendor Expenses, FY15-FY24
communications.communication:
Hello,

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I am hereby submitting a Public Records Request for all money given from Mount Wachusett Community College to external vendors/suppliers in FY2015 through (and including) FY2024, a total of 10 years.

Specifically, the data I am requesting include (but are not limited to):
* all vendors, suppliers, individuals, and public-private partnerships
* all materials, goods, services, properties, commodities, equipment leases, property leases, and licenses
* all catalog orders, non-catalog orders, blanket orders, direct payments, bank card purchases, strategic sourcing, and competitive procurements
* all auxiliary services purchases (starts in 2022, may be from a different accounting system)
* all purchase orders, requisitions, and invoices
* all products, goods, services, contracts, and subcontracts
* all accounts, classes, commodities, and departments
* regardless of the funding source

I’m requesting the data in a single Excel spreadsheet file (.xlsx format) with at least the following columns:
* Amount
* Supplier/Vendor Name
* Account Description
* Commodity Description
* Fiscal Year
* Department/Origin Description

Please report every expense, even if one or more of the above fields is blank. Please also include negative expense amounts, which is rare but does occur.

In case it’s helpful, I've attached an image example of what I’m hoping to receive. The columns may be in any order, and the fiscal years may be on one sheet or different sheets. The columns can be sorted in any order, or unsorted if that’s easiest.

I’m anticipating that this request may be fulfilled by a simple financial report generation and export of the generated file, and therefore shouldn’t take much human time or incur any fees. Please let me know immediately if this isn’t the case, so I can modify my request as necessary to meet the PRL deadline of 10 business days.

Please email the Excel file by the deadline of Monday August 26th, 2024.

Thank you very much!

Sincerely,

AJ Vincelli
Graduate Student Union at UMass Dartmouth

communications.subject: Re: [External]RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Mount Wachusett CC Vendor Expenses, FY15-FY24
communications.communication:
AJ  - following up on your request below, please know that after reviewing the report again it does appear there are duplicates stemming from parameters used to complete the initial data pull.  The programmers are refining the search parameters to hopefully eliminate the duplications with a goal of getting the updated version back to you by the end of this week.  Thank you for your patience and understanding during the very busy start of the new academic year.
R/
Pete




Peter H. Sennett

Public Record Access Officer

Mount Wachusett Community College

communications.communication:
AJ –
My apologies that this follow up was apparently overlooked.  I have again engaged the programmers to revisit the data pull to see if they can determine how to eliminate what appear to be duplicate entries.  While we are somewhat short staffed this week in light of the holiday I will seek to expedite efforts to revisit the query.

Sincerely,

Pete

AJ Vincelli

communications.subject: RE: [External]RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Mount Wachusett CC Vendor Expenses, FY15-FY24
communications.communication:
AJ –
Further inquiry to the issue of duplicate entries revealed that our system of record may include multiple records of a line item when more than one division or department in the College may have responsibility for, or a role in, the service or acquisition ultimately received to show allocation to a relevant cost center.   I have attached a copy of the previous data pull with duplicate entries removed via the Excel “remove duplicates” tool.
Thank you for your patience and understanding.  Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Sincerely,

Pete

communications.subject: Iowa Open Records Law Request: Agency Roster (Eldora Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Iowa Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: 3Arts UIChicago Fellowship Program, 2023-present
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any communications, memoranda, documents, public complaints, or records, from January 1, 2023 to present, pertaining to the 3Arts University of Illinois Chicago Fellowship Program.

For reference, the National Endowment for the Arts issued a blog post on November 3, 2023 about this organization, which is available here (https://www.arts.gov/stories/blog/2021/grant-spotlight-3arts-university-illinois-chicago-fellowship-program).
Additionally, the grant description is available under ID number 1917004-72-24.

In order to help to determine my status to assess fees, you should know that I am affiliated with an educational institution, and this request is made for a scholarly purpose.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Max Sullivan

communications.subject: NEA FOIA Request No. F25-037 | Final Response
communications.communication:
Dear Max Sullivan:

Thank you for your interest in the National Endowment for the Arts.

This e-mail responds to your request for records under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. §552, file number F25-037.  You requested records as follows:

  *   "Any communications, memoranda, documents, public complaints, or records, from January 1, 2023 to present, pertaining to the 3Arts University of Illinois Chicago Fellowship Program."
Attached are the responsive documents for your FOIA request with minimal redactions.  Information regarding an organization's internal financial decision making has been redacted under exemption (b)(4), which protects confidential financial and commercial information, 5 U.S.C. §552(b)(4).  Salary information, dates from which age may be inferred, and other personal data have been redacted in accordance with exemption (b)(6), which protects against "a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy," 5 U.S.C. §552(b)(6).   The NEA has considered the foreseeable harm standard in reviewing records and applying FOIA exemptions.

The National Endowment for the Arts is governed by the provisions of the National Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities Act, 20 U.S.C. 951 et seq., and the Freedom of Information Act with respect to the release of agency records.  In accordance with the NEA's FOIA regulations, 45 CFR 1148.8, you may appeal the Agency's determination.  Such an appeal must be made to the NEA Chair not less than ninety days after the date of receipt of this e-mail. Additional information about the appeal process can be found at FOIA| NEA<https://www.arts.gov/about/freedom-of-information-act-foia-guide> .

If you would like to discuss our response before filing an appeal to attempt to resolve your dispute, you can contact our FOIA Public Liaison FOIA Public Liaison<https://www.arts.gov/foia/foia-contacts> for assistance.  If we are unable to resolve your FOIA dispute through our FOIA Public Liaison, the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS), the Federal FOIA Ombudsman office, offers mediation services to help resolve disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies.  The contact information for OGIS is:

Office of Government Information Services
National Archives and Records Administration
8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS
College Park, MD 20740-6001
ogis@nara.gov

Sincerely,

FOIA | Office of the General Counsel
National Endowment for the Arts
400 7th Street SW | Washington DC 20506
foia@arts.gov

 [NEA Logo]

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Barry Romo (July 24, 1947 – May 1, 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into retired second lieutenant and Vietnam Veterans Against the War leader Barry Romo (July 24, 1947 – May 1, 2024). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his New York Times obituary at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2024/05/15/us/barry-romo-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1639534-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request

If your FOIPA Number is [1195846-0] please enter [1195846-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1195846-1] please enter [1195846-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000
Case Type:
FOIPA
Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)

The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.

You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.


Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system, and the FBI receives a voluminous amount of requests on a daily, weekly, monthly, and annual basis.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Our complex requests are further divided into small (51-250 pages), medium (251-500 pages), large (501-4,999), and extra-large (over 5,000 pages) sub-tracks.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  The more potentially responsive pages a request has, the more complex it becomes, greatly increasing the time required for processing. Generally, the larger the file, the longer it takes to process.
Currently, simple track cases average approximately 230 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Complex requests in the small processing track are currently averaging 1,085 days from the date of receipt for processing, those in the medium processing track are currently averaging 1,310 days, those in the large processing track are currently averaging approximately 2,010 days, and those in the extra-large track are averaging 2,370 days  .


Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Val Brokesmit FBI file
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records, files, and correspondence concerning Valentin "Val" Brokesmit, born in Ukraine in or around 1976, and died in Los Angeles on April 25, 2022. Mr. Brokesmit was known to the FBI as the son of deceased Deutsche Bank executive Bill Broeksmit, and was a source in a federal investigation into Deutsche Bank. A media article establishing that Mr. Brokesmit has recently passed away is available here: https://www.vice.com/en/article/dypbmz/val-broeksmit-deutsche-bank-and-the-birth-of-a-new-conspiracy-theory.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian Waters

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1544055-000
